definition:
A family $\mathcal{F}$ of functions from a metric space $(X,d)$ to a
metric space $(X',d')$ is *uniformly equicontinuous* if, for each
$\varepsilon>0$ there exists $\delta>0$ such that,
$$\forall f\in\mathcal{F},\; \forall x,y\in X,\;\; d(x,y)<\delta \Rightarrow d'(f(x),f(y))<\varepsilon.$$
